intro: Tupa digitalifolia, commonly known as the fingerleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves that resemble fingers, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on hairy stems. Tupa digitalifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
